page.title: 03 Farming around Barham
page.content: The{soil}is mainly chalky,solid chalk underneath with patches of good soil varying from 4 inches to 4 feet;some clay on hills surrounding the valley. Farms in the area range from 53 to 500 acres.Most fields are between 10 and 20 acres,though one farmer had a field of 70 acres,bigger than the smallest farm!{Woodland}in the area is either coppice (used for fencing) or {parkland.}The majority of farms are owned.Locally we have sheep,dairy herds (Fresian)a few chickens(not for their eggs)and crops ie.wheat (flour),barley(beer),oats,lupins and sunflowers(an experiment) and rape for oil,peas,grass(for seed) and beans for human consumption.Local farmers are protecting the area,by keeping trees and retaining small fields,protecting old buildings,even by creating a natural pond for wildlife.
